subject: Re: JUnit 4 restructuring
msgSnippet: ... Minor nit: you might be able to relax the signature thusly: public void  assertThat( T target, Constraint constraint ) e.g. if type T gets
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@m...> wrote:
> public void <T> assertThat (T obj, Constraint<T> constraint);

Minor nit: you might be able to relax the signature thusly:

public void <T> assertThat( T target, Constraint<? super T> constraint )

e.g. if type T gets inferred as java.lang.Integer, there's no reason
why the constraint should not be allowed to be of type, say,
Constraint<Number>.

cheers,
p
